intro: Malus domestica var. roseus, commonly known as the Pink Lady apple, is a cultivar of the domestic apple tree known for its distinctive pinkish-red skin and crisp, sweet flesh. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 4–8 meters, producing small, round fruits in the fall. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are oval-shaped with a smooth margin and a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The flowers are white and fragrant, appearing in spring before the leaves fully develop.
